location: The same. A room in the palace.

lines.text: Enter MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, and others attending

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Eros! mine armour, Eros!

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Sleep a little.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: No, my chuck. Eros, come; mine armour, Eros! Come good fellow, put mine iron on: If fortune be not ours to-day, it is Because we brave her: come.
Enter EROS with armour

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Nay, I'll help too. What's this for?

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Ah, let be, let be! thou art The armourer of my heart: false, false; this, this.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Sooth, la, I'll help: thus it must be.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Well, well; We shall thrive now. Seest thou, my good fellow? Go put on thy defences.

lines.speaker: eros
lines.text: Briefly, sir.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Is not this buckled well?

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Rarely, rarely: He that unbuckles this, till we do please To daff't for our repose, shall hear a storm. Thou fumblest, Eros; and my queen's a squire More tight at this than thou: dispatch. O love, That thou couldst see my wars to-day, and knew'st The royal occupation! thou shouldst see A workman in't. Good morrow to thee; welcome: Thou look'st like him that knows a warlike charge: To business that we love we rise betime, And go to't with delight.
Enter an armed Soldier

lines.speaker: soldier
lines.text: A thousand, sir, Early though't be, have on their riveted trim, And at the port expect you.
Shout. Trumpets flourish
Enter Captains and Soldiers

lines.speaker: captain
lines.text: The morn is fair. Good morrow, general.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Good morrow, general.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: 'Tis well blown, lads: This morning, like the spirit of a youth That means to be of note, begins betimes. So, so; come, give me that: this way; well said. Fare thee well, dame, whate'er becomes of me: This is a soldier's kiss: rebukeable And worthy shameful cheque it were, to stand On more mechanic compliment; I'll leave thee Now, like a man of steel. You that will fight, Follow me close; I'll bring you to't. Adieu.
Kisses her
Exeunt MARK ANTONY, EROS, Captains, and Soldiers

lines.speaker: charmian
lines.text: Please you, retire to your chamber.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Lead me. He goes forth gallantly. That he and Caesar might Determine this great war in single fight! Then Antony,--but now--Well, on.
Exeunt
